intro: Polypompholyx tenella, commonly known as the common tansy, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in umbels. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia and thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is often found in wet meadows, stream banks, and woodland areas. Polypompholyx tenella is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
